fields.description: When exporting pages from a space, there should be a way to auto-select all the children of a parent page rather than having to click on each individual child page (which can be time consuming when attempting to export a complete hierarchy of children).
fields.summary: Export Space page should allow selecting a parent and all its children
Improve performance of Export Space page by loading page tree dynamically

fields.description:
Your Notation guide says: "Allowed columns are: key, summary, type, created, updated, assignee, reporter, priority, status, resolution."

It would be good to allow the following fields which are currently not supported:

- Fix Version/s
- Remaining Work
- Due Date
- Component
- Parent (for subtasks)
fields.summary: Support all built-in JIRA fields in the {jiraissues} macro
Livesearch macro results in pane should be same as results in search view

fields.description: Escape shortcut should mimic the behaviour of the close link - they currently have different effects on the search parameter within the textfield.
fields.summary: LiveSearch macro - close link and esc. shortcut inconsistent

fields.description:
Thumbnails of animated gifs are currently broken, so we should also display the name of the image which we are thumbnailing.

Can I suggest that we also include image names when displaying the
images, as currently thumbnailing an animated gif can sometimes result
in a blank box (frame 1 is thumbnailed I think).

m
fields.summary: Thumbnailing should display image name

fields.description:

> -- Top and bottom boxes have different padding?
> -- Top and bottom boxes aren't the same width

fields.description:
If you have a template variable with markup inside a table, the rendering breaks:

Example:

||Description|@VAR|textarea(10 x 80)@| 

This *should* work: see http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Structured+Content+with+Templates
fields.summary: template structured content breaking - ||Description|@VAR|textarea(10 x 80)@|

fields.description:
[^attachment.txt] are not exported correctly. In fact the exported HTML page would link to the _directory_ of the attachment page. 

This bug is critical for us, as we are using Confluence as CMS, and we need to export to static pages with attachment. Currently we need to manually fix the incorrectly generated page.
fields.summary: Links to Attachment disappeared in exported HTML page

fields.description:
When session.flush() fails in the sessioninview filter, we lose the call to super.closeSession(), which means the session is never properly cleaned up and the connection isn't freed.

This is also the cause of that annoying "ClobStringType requires active transaction synchronization" masking error message.
fields.summary: Possible connection leakage when session.flush() fails

fields.summary: Comment preview loses threading info

fields.description:
We don't have functional tests for some crucial areas of the XML-RPC / SOAP remote APIs.

Currently we have tests for the login operations, basic space operations and basic user operations. 

We really need acceptance tests covering _every_ remote operation. Testing XML-RPC only should be good enough as that's backed onto SOAP internally, but we should add at least one moderately complex SOAP test so that we ensure SOAP is deploying properly.

I've also fixed CONF-2583, but this hasn't really been tested at all (had to commit as I am heading back to NY). So make sure to test all operations but especially take care with the getChildren(), getDescendents(), getAncestors() methods.
fields.summary: RPC test suite needs improving

fields.description:
Let's investigate how hard this is to do. I believe it should be quite simple as all the testing has already been done for us by those nice folks at the other end of the office.

Would be a killer feature to add to our nifty new Insert Image popup.

m
fields.summary: Integrate JIRA's screenshot applet into the "insert image" popup

fields.description:
Viewing mail removes extra blanks between characters.  This differs from the way other mail viewers work. This is important for proportional spaced text with formating.
Example - changes 2 blanks into 1 blank incorrectly:
- Confluence
  Systems installed . . . . . :
  Distributed to systems . . . :
- Correct
  Systems installed  . . . . . :
  Distributed to systems . . . :
fields.summary: Mail display removes important blanks

fields.description:
We have set up our Confluence using AD-integration for authentication. Several users have norwegian characters (æøåÆØÅ) in their user names.

There seems to be an encoding issue when creating links to users profile pages. For instance with the user name 'øystein test':

Create profile link:
[~øystein test]

The resulting URL turns out to be:
https://.../confluence/display/~%25C3%25B8ystein%2Btest

Seems the character 'ø' is double encoded to %25C3%25B8, while it should be %F8. The correct url would be something like this (which works):
https://.../confluence/display/~%F8ystein%2Btest

Regular pages in confluence with Norwegian chars in names work fine. The problem only occurs with user names.

There is also an issue with the search box. When entering 'øystein test' in the search field and pressing the search button, no results are found and the name has been changed to 'Ã¸ystein test'. The inline search works fine, for example: {search:query=øystein test}.
fields.summary: Encoding issue - Norwegian char in user name

fields.summary: Allow attachment upload from popups during page create

fields.description:
This would be incredibly useful, and really cheap to add.

Only allow one-at-a-time uploading, and hide the form on page-creation since that would be much harder to implement.
fields.summary: Allow attachment upload from the "Insert link" and "Insert image" popups on page edit

fields.description:
1) Modify the tree view so when you open a particular page in context, its children are also displayed open.
2) Use the href fallback on the expando-s so that if a user doesn't have Javascript enabled, or they are using a browser that doesn't support XMR, clicking on an expando will reload the page with that part of the heirarchy open.
3) Do something similar for closing an expando.

Don't worry about keeping a running track of everything that is open or closed - just open whatever one they asked for at that moment (if they want it to be fully functional, they should turn JS on).
fields.summary: Make content tree work for unsupported browsers

fields.description:
Allow a setup where individual spaces on a Confluence server can be sold as a service.

At a minimum we'll need to:

* Push relevant parts of the global configuration (enabled macros, CamelCase, etc) down to the space-config level
* Allow global admins to enable per-space user management, limiting what groups are available to what spaces, and how many users can be created in these groups.

Virtual hosting would also be useful.
fields.summary: Make ASP-style Confluence hosting feasable

fields.description:
Replication steps:

- make changes to a page
- click "Info" tab
- click "Changes" to view changes between last two versions
- click "View" tab

You are now viewing the "old" page, not the most recent page. I think this is a confusing context switch. View tab should always go to the most recent version of the page in this case.

fields.description:
We just acquired a full license of Confluence, partly in order to use as a portal for each department, with links to the various resources and knowledge sources we already have in place. Being to link to them is therefore of critical importance. Most of these sources are for better or for worse in Lotus Notes databases. Unfortunately it seems Confluence doesn't currently support the notes:// protocol in links. It does not convert such links to a hyperlink and instead highlights them as errors.

Please could we add notes:// to the list of protocols understood? There are loads of others that might be useful; I'm not sure if they're included at the moment. e.g. 

notes:// 
ftp:// 
etc...


This looks very similar to issue JRA-2096, which has been resolved almost two years ago, in the oscore library. To quote Charles Miller, "Unfortunately, we couldn't use the oscore URL-locating code in Confluence, as it was incompatible with all the other stuff that needed to be done during the page->wiki conversion."
fields.summary: Hyperlink other protocols (e.g. notes://) automatically

fields.description:
It looks like Confluence's trackback ping support is broken.  I have created links between these two pages, but neither registered as a ping in the other:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/Target+Confluence+page
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TST-2352

both pages are accessible anonymously)

A ping from my local JIRA instance to http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TST-2352 succeeded, which is why I suspect that Confluence is the party at fault.
fields.summary: Trackback incoming pings ignored

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3081].
  {panel}

When usermanagement is delegated to Jira, the user has to signup in Jira. That can be confusing.

The following occured to a user:
a) Administrator set up confluence and Jira
b) He set it up to make Jira hold the user data
c) I have admin rights too and was cleaning up some UI issues and have been directing new users to confluence as I was afraid they woudl be scared of Jira
d) Hmmm .. no "sign-up" page.
e) So I enable it. but it won't work. Error. Admin tells me I am a loser .. and that I should send users to Jira to signup .. then back to confluence to log in. 

Better integration would be a good thing. So if Jira and confluence were linked .. Confluence "knows" to add a "sign up" link (if it's turned on) that points to Jira instead.
fields.summary: enhancement  to sign up when integrated with Jira

fields.description:
We have a minor control issue here with Confluence for documents that require approval by stakeholders, IRM etc.  It would be really useful if it were obvious which version of a page people were looking at.  That way they could specifically approve version 5 of the architecture document, for example.  All this needs is a little macro to allow us to display the page version on the page itself, rather than having to click 'Previous versions'.  Is this do-able?

Cheers,

  Mike

fields.description:
The content tree in the "pages" area of a space is disjoint from the Table of Contents for an individual page.  If these two ideas were linked together then we could use the Content Tree as a true "Table of Contents" for an entire space.

In this fashion a user could also add "Next" and "Previous" links so the site can read more like a book. 

If you were to merge the concept of Content Tree and Table Of Contents by indexing the pages according to the 'h1. - h6.' header tags and then you could have:

Content Tree

home
  |
  = Section 1
      |
      = Page 1
          |
          = Page1.h1. 
              | 
              = Page 1.h2.
       | 
       = Page 2 
           |
           = ...
   | 
   = Section 2 (realy just another page.)
       |
       = ...

In this manner you can also build "next", "previous", and "up" links into a page automatically.
fields.summary: Allow option to have Content Tree index header tags as well.

fields.description:
Scenario:
---------
Edit a page, changing the page title and the page content.
View the page version history and you will see two new versions, one representing the content change, and the other the page title change.

A page edit action should only create a single new version.
fields.summary: Editing a page's content and title creates 2 new versions.

fields.description:
We have integrated Tomcat with Apache so that people can get to Confluence on port 80. This is primarily so that it can be used by people who are connecting via VPNs and other remote access services, other ports being are disallowed by our Info. Sec. people.

Thinking through this a little further, it's now possible to subscribe to RSS feeds using a 'normal' port 80 url. However the links inside the RSS file will still be pointing to Tomcat directly. Any user subscribed to the feed while using the VPN will not be able to open the page in their browser.
fields.summary: RSS feed urls when Tomcat integrated with Apache

fields.description:
I have observed this on a couple of occassions before and was finally able to get all the information I could possibly get. Attached to this bug is a thread dump of a tomcat 4.1.30 container running confluence. For some pages (I have not yet figured which one's), adding and trying to subsequently modify the content of the page results in locked threads. 

The attached log file has 2 thread dumps; the first dump shows TP-Processor6 waiting on some locks.. the second dump taken after a while when porforming the same update operation on the same page shows TP-processor3 locked with similar stack trace and locks. 

Please let me know if I can provide  any other information to help resolve this issue. Thanks.

The content of the page is below: 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


h1. Initial Design Discussion

h3. Motivation
Currently we receive project definition files from the Outbound Phone (OBP) methodology, which provides needed data that uniquely defines the project, provides labelling for the project, and specifies the definition of all the questions in the corresponding OBP survey.  The way OBP references and labels its questions is unique to the methodology.  OBP is also, for all intents and purposes, a closed system.  It can't hit external databases, and other systems have difficulty hitting the internal of OBP.

There is an emerging need to have some more standard way across data collection methodologies to reference questions, and for many applications to be able to access a central place for question information.  QBank is the answer.

As such, Eldorado needs to be able to receive question information for QBank and create views based on that information.  IVR and OBP (and SCAN later perhaps) will enter project/defintion information in the form of questionnaires into QBank.  Question IDs will be allocated and managed by QBank.  QBank will also send information on the practice, product, and client id that pertain to the project.

h3. Use Cases
*Qbank Sends Def File First, Then Phone Sends Its Version*
We parse the QBank file and create a project in the PROJECTS table and create the question_id view, populating the PROJECT_VIEWS table with the appropriate info.  When Phone subsequently sends its version, the project is updated with any information not included in the QBank file, and then the DEFINITIONS table is updated with the new defs.  The q_tag view is created as usual.

*Phone Sends Def File First, Then QBank*
Proceeed with normal processing of Phone def file.  When QBank send its file the defs are matched up and the additional q_id info is added to the defs in the DEFINITIONS table.  The q_id view is created as in the first use case.

*Updated Def File Sent From Phone*
The update will replace all past information, as it does currently.  QBank data will need to be mapped over to the new set of project/defintion information, much like VCT-centric information is now.

*Updated Def File Sent From QBank*
Added information will be added, and updates to QBank-specific info will be updated.  {color:red} Not sure about removal of defs from QBank view.{color}

{info:title=Note}Any conflicts between Phone and QBank at any point will be resolved by favoring Phone information over QBank information, as Phone ultimately is in control of the data.  If conflicts arise, all QBank information will be deleted, and email will be sent to the proper people.{info}




----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

fields.description:
I asked about customizing the default page on space creation.
Charles noted that it can be done, but by changing confluencd.cfg.xml.

Access to the filesystem can often be much more difficult than admin
web-access. So I'd prefer be able to set a "new space" template from the Admin Web
UI. 

And since we tend to have a couple categories of spaces (ex. Team,
Project).. I'd like to have multiple default pages to select from when
creating the space. 

Oh, and I'd like to have it all exposed via the API so I could automate
the process of space request/creation. :-)

Nick M. noted some good reasons why storing in the filesystem would be less preferable:
> The problem with the filesystem approach is
> a) its often not easy to get access to the filesystem (firewalls, etc)
> b) you have to start giving out os/filesystem permissions on top of
> confluence permissioning - its extra overhead.
> c) its not transactional (not trivially, anyway)
> d) its a big barrier to clustering (having to share a 
> filesystem is very
> expensive - as well as being quite limiting)
> e) the versioning isnt integrated, and also a pita (I assume 
> you mean using
> cvs...)
> f) its a PITA when you have to move between staging and live 
> (you have a
> filesystem dependancy in addition to the EAR)
> 
> In short, in our environment, we are very small fans of using the
> filesystem for storing data (we leave that work to the database)
> 
> -Nick
>

The problem:
Valid license keys are being incorrectly identified as invalid during the confluence setup process.

When running confluence in standalone mode, license key X works fine.
When running confluence from within IDEA, that same licence key is being marked as invalid. 

Workaround:
Extracting the com/atlassian/confluence/page/Page.key file from atlassian-extras and placing it at the head of the classpath. This implies that another (invalid) Page.key file is being picked from somewhere else.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3036].
  {panel}

At the moment, searching for "hello-to-the-world" in Confluence always returns the same results as "hello to the world". This situation also applies for symbols like plus, underscore, period, dollar sign, percent sign, and so on. 

There's also no way to prevent asterisks being treated as wildcard characters in Lucene, so you can't search for a word like "*plea*" and match content with asterisks around the word.

Words are also not split on dots, so you can't search for "somefile" and find pages that contains "somefile.txt" or "somefile.doc" in the text.

*Technical notes*

This is due to how Confluence's search tokenises search requests. It splits the query up into words based on letter characters, and ignores all symbols in the request. We use Lucene's [StandardTokenizer|http://lucene.apache.org/java/2_9_1/api/core/org/apache/lucene/analysis/standard/StandardTokenizer.html] in our EnglishAnalyzer, and similar implementations for other languages.

Here is the description of the behaviour of StandardTokenizer from Lucene:

{quote}
* Splits words at punctuation characters, removing punctuation. However, a dot that's not followed by whitespace is considered part of a token.
* Splits words at hyphens, unless there's a number in the token, in which case the whole token is interpreted as a product number and is not split.
* Recognizes email addresses and internet hostnames as one token.
{quote}

An example of the grammar for this tokenizer can be viewed here: [StandardTokenizerImpl.jflex|https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/lucene/dev/branches/branch_3x/lucene/src/java/org/apache/lucene/analysis/standard/StandardTokenizerImpl.jflex].

fields.description:
It would be great to have user related timezones, like in Druple  ;-)

"Select your current local time. Dates and times throughout this site will be displayed using this time zone."

Our wiki is hosted in the states (and changing the clock on that server is not an option), so all edit happen with a US time zone  :(

Thanks in advance  ;-)

Stephan

fields.description: All emails added to Confluence are displayed with all of their formatting removed.  No newlines, no spaces, no tabs.  This has been true with emails sent from Outlook 2003 through Exchange Server 2000.  I can not verify for other clients.
fields.summary: All emails sent to Confluence have their formatting completely stripped.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3028].
  {panel}

If you try to use Confluence to build a community outside of an business organization (imagine a big Open Source project of people all over the place), there's no integrated way with Confluence to be able to send messages to other specific Confluence users.  Having an integrated system means people can protect their privacy and you don't need to maintain yourself some page of contact information which would require people to leave the application.

Here's how I'd envision it being implemented featurewise:
* You click on an envelope by a person's name (on anything they've written/modified/etc) or from their Confluence profile page to send them a private message.
* When a person logs in, their Dashboard should mention that they have new messages with a link to view their mailbox.
* There should also be some sort of status-dependent icon at the top right (where the history/profile/print etc icons) are that gives a link to your mailbox.  If you have mail, the icon looks obviously different than if your mail is all read.
* If the person is subscribed to notifications for the site overall, that should include a summary of any new mailbox messages.
* It might also be nice to have a separate, independent notification of new messages.  That is, you don't need to subscribe to the site notification, you can just opt to be e-mailed (if you've provided an address) a notification that you have a new private message in Confluence.
* A user can access their mailbox from the icon mentioned earlier (top right of the screen) or from the profile page or from the Dashboard.
* Once in the mailbox, they are presented with a list of mail messages, ordered by date sent, with some sort of indicator for read/unread, message title, and from information.  Thread visualization/grouping might be nice.    It might also be nice to have checkboxes beside each message (with a select/unselect all!) where you can do mass deletions from this screen.
* When a user clicks on a message to read it, they have some message options: reply, reply with quote, delete, forward to external e-mail address. These work as you would expect.
* The administration screen should have some configuration options for how many messages a user can have or how much space they can take up or how long they're kept around for.  You might need parameters for more than one of these and the mailboxes are pruned nightly depending on which one they're closest to at the time or something.  Not sure about the logistics here, but I'm sure something is needed to keep it from ballooning horrendously.

I imagine this could be implemented maybe as some kind of plug-in, but I'm not sure.  I think many of the tools you need to do this sort of thing are probably already written because:
- there is already a way to write content and format it
- there is already a mechanism for threading messages, etc.
- there is already sme kind of GUI for looking at mail messages and managing them (although I haven't used this myself)
fields.summary: Integrated Private Messaging to Users

fields.description:
There seems to be an inconsistency with the documentation on how delegate user management to JIRA. 

I am referring to step 4 found on the page http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/How+to+delegate+user+management+in+Confluence+to+JIRA 

The chain.configuration.provider.class in the block of code I am suppose to uncomment is:

com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceHibernateConfigProvider

The actual block of code that is in the osuser.xml in my installation is:

    <!-- JIRA User management (with caching) -->
    <!-- Note: Do not add any line breaks or spaces when specifying the chain.classname, otherwise a ClassNotFoundException will be thrown -->
    <provider class="bucket.user.providers.CachingCredentialsProvider">
        <property name="chain.classname">com.atlassian.confluence.user.providers.jira.JiraJdbcCredentialsProvider</property>
        <property name="chain.datasource">java:comp/env/jdbc/JiraDS</property>
    </provider>
    <provider class="bucket.user.providers.CachingAccessProvider">
        <property name="chain.classname">com.atlassian.confluence.user.providers.jira.JiraJdbcAccessProvider</property>
        <property name="chain.datasource">java:comp/env/jdbc/JiraDS</property>
    </provider>
    <provider class="bucket.user.providers.CachingProfileProvider">
        <property name="chain.classname">com.atlassian.confluence.user.providers.jira.JiraJdbcProfileProvider</property>
        <property name="chain.datasource">java:comp/env/jdbc/JiraDS</property>
        <property name="chain.configuration.provider.class">bucket.user.BucketHibernateConfigProvider</property>
    </provider>
fields.summary: Inconsistency in JIRA user delegation document

fields.description:
There is a layout problem with IE5.5 (PC) that sounds like a CSS issue on the edit page screen.
I would have taken a screen shot, but I can't actually replicate this bug, as for some reason dummy "stub" versions of IE 501 and 55 won't log in successfully (perhaps a separate issue?). The issue arose for a client that is using IE5.5. From her description over the phone:
1) the Help Tips take up half the screen, and overlaps a lot of the formf, making editing quite difficult.
2) all the top fields appear (title, etc) and the main text box, as well as the permissions drop down menu
3) the form buttons are not visible (update preview cancel) making saving changes tricky :) I suggested a workaround which was to click outside the text field, and hit enter, which succesfully submitted the form.
fields.summary: Visual layout problems with IE5.5

fields.description:
Currently there's no way to view all blog posts, by month, or otherwise.

The only way to currently list blogposts is to view the most recent, which will only show 15. Apparently we used to have this functionality in 1.3.x - you could at least find all blogs by clicking on a calendar and moving between months. We really should have a more obvious, administrative view of blogs.
fields.summary: View all blog posts, not only most recent.
Users can create templates if they can create pages.
